1.text: Brethren, if even a man be taken in some fault, ye who are spiritual restore such a one in a spirit of meekness, considering thyself lest thou also be tempted.

2.text: Bear one anotherâ€™s burdens, and thus fulfil the law of the Christ.

3.text: For if any man reputes himself to be something, being nothing, he deceives himself;

4.text: but let each prove his own work, and then he will have his boast in what belongs to himself alone, and not in what belongs to another.

5.text: For each shall bear his own burden.

6.text: Let him that is taught in the word communicate to him that teaches in all good things.

7.text: Be not deceived: God is not mocked; for whatever a man shall sow, that also shall he reap.

8.text: For he that sows to his own flesh, shall reap corruption from the flesh; but he that sows to the Spirit, from the Spirit shall reap eternal life:

9.text: but let us not lose heart in doing good; for in due time, if we do not faint, we shall reap.

10.text: So then, as we have occasion, let us do good towards all, and specially towards those of the household of faith.

11.text: See how long a letter I have written to you with my own hand.

12.text: As many as desire to have a fair appearance in [the] flesh, these compel you to be circumcised, only that they may not be persecuted because of the cross of Christ.

13.text: For neither do they that are circumcised themselves keep the law; but they wish you to be circumcised, that they may boast in your flesh.

14.text: But far be it from me to boast save in the cross of our Lord Jesus Christ, through whom [the] world is crucified to me, and I to the world.

15.text: For [in Christ Jesus] neither is circumcision anything, nor uncircumcision; but new creation.

16.text: And as many as shall walk by this rule, peace upon them and mercy, and upon the Israel of God.

17.text: For the rest let no one trouble me, for I bear in my body the brands of the Lord Jesus.

18.text: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ [be] with your spirit, brethren. Amen.
